title: travelplanner: Can you help design a 5-day travel plan for a group of 4, starting from Evansville and visiting 2 cities in Texas? The trip spans from March 12th to March 16th, 2022. Our budget is now $9,500, and for accommodations, we require entire rooms that do not restrict parties. Also, note that we prefer to avoid airline transportation. (8c4f7657f8b09b07)

always_included_messages.content: Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.

chat_history.content: Can you help design a 5-day travel plan for a group of 4, starting from Evansville and visiting 2 cities in Texas? The trip spans from March 12th to March 16th, 2022. Our budget is now $9,500, and for accommodations, we require entire rooms that do not restrict parties. Also, note that we prefer to avoid airline transportation.

# Texas Road Trip Itinerary

## Day 1 (March 12th):
- Depart Evansville, Indiana, and drive towards St. Louis, Missouri. It will be a 2-hour drive.
- Spend some time in St. Louis exploring the Gateway Arch, a iconic monument offering beautiful views of the city. You can also visit the City Museum, a unique attraction with fun exhibits and activities for all ages.
- Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant like Pappy's Smokehouse for some classic St. Louis-style barbecue.
- After lunch, continue your drive to Dallas, Texas. This leg of the journey will take approximately 10 hours, so consider rotating drivers to ensure a safe trip.
- Check into your accommodation: Kasa Dallas Apartments. This property offers entire apartments suitable for groups and is located in the vibrant Deep Ellum neighborhood.
- In the evening, explore the nearby Deep Ellum Entertainment District, known for its live music venues, street art, and vibrant nightlife. You can catch a show at the House of Blues or enjoy dinner and drinks at one of the many restaurants and bars.

## Day 2 (March 13th):
- After breakfast at a local cafe, visit the Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden, especially if you're visiting during the spring when the flowers are in full bloom.
- Head to the Sixth Floor Museum at Dealey Plaza to learn about the history of the JFK assassination.
- For lunch, try some authentic Tex-Mex cuisine at Mi Cocina, a local favorite.
- In the afternoon, visit the Perot Museum of Nature and Science, an interactive museum with fascinating exhibits.
- End the day at the Dallas World Aquarium, home to various marine life and animal species.
- For dinner, indulge in a steakhouse experience at Y.O. Ranch Steakhouse, known for its Texas-sized portions and excellent service.

## Day 3 (March 14th):
- Leave Dallas and drive towards Austin, which will take around 3-4 hours.
- Upon arrival, check into your accommodation: Guild Victory. This apartment-style hotel offers spacious rooms and is located close to the city's attractions.
- Start your Austin exploration at the Texas State Capitol, a stunning building with guided tours available.
- Walk to the nearby South Congress Avenue, a vibrant street lined with unique shops, restaurants, and food trucks. Enjoy some people-watching and browse the local boutiques.
- For dinner, experience the famous Franklin Barbecue (be prepared for long lines, as it's a popular spot!).
- End the night at a rooftop bar like The White Horse for live music and drinks.

## Day 4 (March 15th):
- Visit the Lady Bird Lake Hike and Bike Trail for a scenic morning walk or rent kayaks/stand-up paddleboards for a unique perspective of the city.
- After working up an appetite, head to Jo's Coffee for a famous 'I love you so much' mural photo opportunity and a delicious breakfast.
- Spend the afternoon at the Barton Springs Pool, a natural spring-fed pool with year-round warm water.
- In the late afternoon, visit the South Austin Beer Garden for a variety of craft beers and a casual atmosphere.
- For dinner, try the iconic Gumbo's, serving Cajun and Creole cuisine.
- Austin is known for its live music, so catch a show at venues like Stubb's BBQ or The Continental Club.

## Day 5 (March 16th):
- On your final day, begin the drive back to Evansville, Indiana, stopping at various attractions along the way to break up the long journey.
- You might want to stop at the Oklahoma City National Memorial & Museum to pay respects and learn about the tragic bombing incident.
- Another potential stop is the Route 66 Museum in Clinton, Oklahoma, to explore the history of the iconic highway.
- For lunch, you can try local restaurants in Oklahoma City or pack snacks for a picnic along the route.
- Continue driving towards Evansville, and consider stopping at the Osage Casino in Tulsa for a quick break and entertainment.
- Your journey back to Evansville will take approximately 14-15 hours, including stops, so ensure you take turns driving and stay well-rested.

## Accommodation:
- Kasa Dallas Apartments (Dallas) - $1500 for 2 nights (based on availability)
- Guild Victory (Austin) - $2000 for 2 nights (based on availability)

## Estimated Budget:
- Accommodations: $3500
- Food and Activities: $4000
- Gas and Miscellaneous Expenses: $2000
- Total Estimated Cost: $9500

*Note: This itinerary provides a balance of activities and driving time. However, please note that travel times may vary, and you can adjust the schedule as needed during your trip. The accommodation prices are estimates, and you may find better deals or alternative options that fit your preferences. Enjoy your Texas adventure!*

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
